title: Rhind Mathematical Papyrus
blurb: Egyptian text with arithmetic, fractions, and geometry problems; a window into early algorithmic methods.
details: Unit-fraction decompositions like $\tfrac{2}{3} = \tfrac{1}{2} + \tfrac{1}{6}$ illustrate computational practice.

title: Sulba Sutras
blurb: Ancient Indian geometric rules for altar constructions, including early statements of the Pythagorean relation.
details: A form of $a^2 + b^2 = c^2$ appears in geometric constructions and area computations.

title: Pythagorean Theorem
blurb: The Pythagorean school studies integer triples and the right-triangle relation central to Greek geometry.
details: Right triangle relation: $a^2 + b^2 = c^2$; integer solutions like $(3,4,5)$.

title: Euclid's Elements
blurb: Axiomatic treatment of geometry and number theory; the classical model for deductive structure.
details: Proof of infinitude of primes and geometry from postulates; Book VII–IX cover number theory.

title: Archimedes' Method of Exhaustion
blurb: Rigorous area and volume computations foreshadowing integral calculus; estimates for $\pi$.
details: Polygon bounds give $3\tfrac{10}{71} < \pi < 3\tfrac{1}{7}$.

title: Eratosthenes' Sieve
blurb: Systematic sieve to enumerate primes, a prototype for algorithmic number theory.
details: Iteratively mark multiples to list primes $2,3,5,7,11,\dots$.

title: Diophantus' Arithmetica
blurb: Collection on rational solutions of polynomial equations, inspiring later number theory.
details: Diophantine problems seek integer/rational solutions to $f(x_1,\dots,x_n)=0$.

title: Brahmagupta and Zero
blurb: Rules for zero and negative numbers; methods for quadratic equations and astronomy.
details: Quadratic formula appears in verse; operations include $a+0=a$ and $a\cdot 0=0$.

title: Al-Khwarizmi's Algebra
blurb: Systematic solution of linear and quadratic equations; the term 'algebra' and 'algorithm' trace to his work.
details: Completing the square solves $ax^2+bx=c$, leading to $x=\frac{-b+\sqrt{b^2+4ac}}{2a}$.

title: Fibonacci's Liber Abaci
blurb: Introduces Hindu–Arabic numerals to Europe; commercial arithmetic and the Fibonacci sequence.
details: Rabbit problem yields $F_{n+1}=F_n+F_{n-1}$ with $F_1=F_2=1$.

title: Cardano's Ars Magna
blurb: General solutions for cubic and quartic equations; complex numbers emerge in intermediate steps.
details: Cubic $x^3+px=q$ solved via radicals; Bombelli clarifies complex arithmetic later.

title: Viète's Symbolic Algebra
blurb: Systematic use of symbols for unknowns and parameters, enabling general algebraic manipulation.
details: Letters represent magnitudes; relations become transformable expressions.

title: Napier's Logarithms
blurb: Logarithms simplify multiplication and pave the way for slide rules and analytic computation.

title: Descartes' Analytic Geometry
blurb: Coordinates link algebra and geometry; curves expressed as equations in $x,y$.
details: Lines have equations like $y=mx+b$; conics by quadratic equations.

title: Newton's Calculus (notes)
blurb: During the plague years Newton develops fluxions and the binomial series; parallel work by Leibniz soon after.
details: Derivative and integral as inverse processes; $\frac{d}{dx}x^n=nx^{n-1}$.

title: Leibniz on Differential Calculus
blurb: Leibniz publishes his differential calculus with the enduring notation $dx,dy$ and $\int$.
details: Product rule: $d(uv)=u\,dv+v\,du$; integral sign from long S for 'summa'.

title: Newton's Principia
blurb: Foundations of classical mechanics using geometric arguments; calculus underlies the methods.
details: Inverse-square law yields conic orbits; Kepler's third law $T^2 \propto a^3$.

title: Law of Large Numbers
blurb: Jacob Bernoulli's posthumous Ars Conjectandi formalizes long-run frequency convergence.
details: For i.i.d. Bernoulli($p$): $\bar X_n \to p$ in probability.

title: Euler and the Bridges of Königsberg
blurb: Birth of graph theory and topology from a recreational puzzle about traversing bridges once.
details: Degree parity criterion: an Eulerian circuit requires every vertex to have even degree.

title: Euler's Introductio
blurb: Functions take center stage; exponential and trigonometric connections crystallize.
details: Euler's identity: $e^{i\pi}+1=0$ encapsulates key constants and operations.

title: Bayes' Theorem
blurb: Posthumous essay introduces inverse probability; cornerstone of Bayesian inference.

title: Fundamental Theorem of Algebra
blurb: Gauss shows every non-constant complex polynomial has a complex root (first proof, later made rigorous).
details: $p(z) \in \mathbb C[z]$ of degree $n$ factors into $n$ linear terms over $\mathbb C$.

title: Disquisitiones Arithmeticae
blurb: Gauss founds modern number theory: congruences, quadratic reciprocity, binary quadratic forms.
details: Quadratic reciprocity relates solvability of $x^2 \equiv p \pmod q$ and $x^2 \equiv q \pmod p$.

title: Cauchy's Cours d'Analyse
blurb: Rigorous epsilon–delta foundations for limits, continuity, series, and differentiation.
details: Definition: $f$ continuous at $a$ if $\forall \varepsilon \exists \delta: |x-a|<\delta \Rightarrow |f(x)-f(a)|<\varepsilon$.

title: Fourier's Heat Theory
blurb: Partial differential equations and trigonometric series enter analysis and physics.
details: Heat equation $u_t=\alpha u_{xx}$ with series solutions $u(x,t)=\sum c_n e^{-\alpha n^2 \pi^2 t} \sin(n\pi x)$.

title: Non-Euclidean Geometry
blurb: Bolyai and Lobachevsky develop consistent geometries with a negation of Euclid's parallel postulate.
details: Hyperbolic geometry: through a point off a line, infinitely many parallels exist.

title: Hamilton's Quaternions
blurb: First noncommutative division algebra; expands algebraic structures beyond complex numbers.
details: $i^2=j^2=k^2=ijk=-1$ with $ij=k$, $ji=-k$, etc.

title: Riemann's Habilitation
blurb: Manifolds and Riemannian metrics generalize geometry; curvature enters intrinsic differential geometry.
details: Metric tensor $g$ defines lengths; curvature via Riemann tensor $R^i_{\ jkl}$.

title: Sylow Theorems
blurb: Classifies p-subgroups in finite groups; central to group structure.

title: Riemann Hypothesis (proposed)
blurb: Zeros of $\zeta(s)$ on $\Re(s)=1/2$ govern prime distribution; central open problem.

title: Cantor's Uncountability of the Reals
blurb: Set theory emerges; reals are uncountable while rationals are countable.
details: Diagonalization shows no bijection $\mathbb N \to \mathbb R$. Many infinities exist.

title: Jordan Curve Theorem
blurb: Every simple closed curve in the plane separates it into inside and outside regions.

title: Prime Number Theorem
blurb: $\pi(x) \sim x/\log x$ proven by Hadamard and de la Vallée Poussin using complex analysis.

people.name: Charles Jean de la Vallée Poussin

title: Foundations of Set Theory and Geometry
blurb: Cantor's axiomatic set theory (1895–97) and Hilbert's Grundlagen (1899) formalize central foundations.
details: Axioms constrain naive comprehension; independence questions soon arise.

title: Hilbert's 23 Problems
blurb: A program-setting list influencing 20th-century research across analysis, algebra, and logic.
details: Problems span continuum hypothesis, decision procedures, and transcendence.

title: Zermelo's Axioms (ZFC beginnings)
blurb: Axiomatic set theory stabilizes with separation and choice; extended by Fraenkel and Skolem to ZFC.
details: Axiom of Choice yields Zorn's Lemma and well-ordering principles.

title: Noether's Theorem
blurb: Symmetries yield conserved quantities in variational problems; deep link between algebra and physics.

title: Russell–Whitehead's Principia Mathematica
blurb: Logicist project to derive mathematics from symbolic logic; advances type theory and formal proof.
details: Hundreds of pages to reach $1+1=2$ highlight foundational ambitions and limits.

title: Noether's Ideal Theory
blurb: Abstract algebra of ideals in rings; ascending chain condition and Noetherian rings.

title: Gödel Completeness Theorem
blurb: First-order logic: syntactic provability equals semantic validity (every consistent theory has a model).

title: Gödel's Incompleteness Theorems
blurb: Any consistent, sufficiently strong formal system cannot prove all truths about arithmetic; cannot prove its own consistency.
details: Self-referential sentence $G$ with $G \leftrightarrow \neg\mathrm{Prov}(\ulcorner G\urcorner)$.

title: Kolmogorov Axioms of Probability
blurb: Measure-theoretic foundations put probability on firm axiomatic footing.

title: Banach–Tarski Paradox
blurb: Using Choice, a ball can be partitioned into finitely many pieces and reassembled into two copies.

title: Hahn–Banach Theorem
blurb: Extension of linear functionals; cornerstone of functional analysis and duality.

title: Turing and Computability
blurb: Turing machines formalize algorithms; the halting problem is undecidable; Church–Turing thesis emerges.
details: No algorithm decides halting for all programs; reductions prove undecidability widely.

title: Category Theory (Eilenberg–Mac Lane)
blurb: Functors and natural transformations organize mathematics at a new level of abstraction.

title: Simplex Method
blurb: Efficient method for linear programming; launches modern optimization.

title: Monte Carlo Method
blurb: Random sampling for numerical estimation; used in physics and computation.

title: Shannon's Information Theory
blurb: Quantifies information and limits of communication; entropy and channel capacity become central.
details: Binary entropy $H(p)=-p\log p-(1-p)\log(1-p)$; capacity bounds reliable transmission.

title: Nash Equilibrium
blurb: Every finite game admits a mixed-strategy equilibrium; foundations for modern game theory.
details: Fixed-point methods show existence of a profile where no player can unilaterally improve.

title: Grothendieck's Schemes (emerging)
blurb: Beginnings of scheme-theoretic algebraic geometry unify number theory and geometry.
details: A scheme locally looks like $\"Spec(A)\"$; morphisms encode arithmetic geometry.

title: Atiyah–Singer Index Theorem
blurb: Relates analytical index of elliptic operators to topological invariants; unifies analysis and topology.

title: Resolution of Singularities
blurb: Hironaka proves resolution in characteristic zero; milestone in algebraic geometry.

title: Cohen: Independence of CH
blurb: Forcing shows the continuum hypothesis and choice are independent of ZF/ZFC (with consistency).
details: Construct models where CH holds and others where it fails; no ZFC decision.

title: Hilbert's Tenth Problem (negative)
blurb: Matiyasevich, building on Davis–Putnam–Robinson, proves no algorithm decides integer solvability of Diophantine equations.
details: Recursively enumerable sets equal Diophantine sets over $\"\mathbb Z\"$.

title: NP-Completeness (Cook–Karp)
blurb: SAT is NP-complete; many problems shown interreducible, framing the P vs NP question.
details: Polynomial-time reductions map problems; $\"\mathrm{SAT}\"$ as a universal NP search problem.

title: Calabi Conjecture (Yau)
blurb: Existence of Kähler–Einstein metrics on compact Kähler manifolds with $c_1=0$ (Calabi–Yau).

title: Four Color Theorem (computer-assisted)
blurb: Appel and Haken prove every planar map is 4-colorable using extensive computer checking.
details: Graph coloring bound $\chi(G) \le 4$ for planar $G$ via reducible configurations.

title: RSA Public-Key Cryptography
blurb: Practical public-key encryption based on integer factorization hardness.

title: Thurston's Geometrization Program
blurb: Three-manifolds decomposed into geometric pieces; blueprint later completed by Perelman.

title: Mirror Symmetry (Homological)
blurb: Kontsevich’s conjecture links symplectic and complex geometry via derived categories and Fukaya categories.

title: Faltings proves Mordell's Conjecture
blurb: Curves of genus $g>1$ over $\mathbb Q$ have finitely many rational points; deep arithmetic geometry.
details: Uses Arakelov theory and diophantine approximation to bound rational points.

title: PCP Theorem
blurb: NP admits probabilistically checkable proofs; hardness of approximation framework.

title: Shor's Factoring Algorithm
blurb: Quantum algorithm factors integers in polynomial time, impacting cryptography.

title: AKS Primality Test
blurb: First unconditional polynomial-time primality test.

title: Wiles proves Fermat's Last Theorem
blurb: All exponents $n>2$ have no nontrivial integer solutions to $x^n+y^n=z^n$, via modularity of elliptic curves.
details: Modularity of semistable elliptic curves implies Fermat; completed with Taylor–Wiles method.

title: Green–Tao Theorem
blurb: The primes contain arbitrarily long arithmetic progressions.

title: Perelman and Poincaré
blurb: Ricci flow with surgery settles the Poincaré conjecture and Thurston's geometrization in dimension 3.
details: Perelman's monotonicity and no-local-collapsing enable controlled surgeries during flow.

title: Flyspeck and Kepler Conjecture
blurb: Hales' proof of optimal sphere packing in $\mathbb R^3$ is fully formalized in HOL Light and Isabelle.
details: Densest packing is face-centered cubic with density $\pi/\sqrt{18}$.

title: Bounded Gaps Between Primes
blurb: Zhang proves finite prime gaps occur infinitely often; Polymath and Maynard refine to small explicit bounds.
details: There exist infinitely many primes $p_n$ with $p_{n+1}-p_n \leq C$ for some absolute $C$.

title: Perfectoid Methods Broaden
blurb: Scholze's perfectoid spaces reshape $p$-adic geometry and the Langlands program; new bridges across arithmetic.
details: Untilts and almost mathematics enable comparisons in $p$-adic Hodge theory.
